goal.ch: 透過本課程的歷練，學員預期將可達到如下四項成果：（1）對印度文明與佛教，形成在哲學研究所必備的認識。（2）由佛教的世界觀反思自身的世界觀。（3）對佛教經典，培養至少相當於研究所水準的閱讀能力。（4）透過佛教經典的解讀，鍛鍊分析、思辨、與論理的能力。
goal.en: (1) To acquire the necessary knowledge of Indian civilization and Buddhism to succeed in interdisciplinary work. (2) To reflect on one’s own worldview by way of Buddhist worldview. (3) To cultivate the skill of reading and interpreting Buddhist scriptures. (4) To enable the students to engage in pholosopical thinking through Buddhist scriptures.

outline.ch: 本課程由生命哲學與宗教哲學的廣大視野，落實在印度文明的佛教，藉由佛教經典的解讀，形成在哲學研究所必備的閱讀水準與哲學思辨。
outline.en: This course will provide the opportunity to read selections from some of the principal genres of Buddhist literature, especially the Āgama-sūtras and the Prajñāpāramitā-sūtras. Several chapters will be highlighted with their philosophical insight into the living world and sentient beings.

textbook.ch:
蔡耀明（主編），《世界文明原典選讀V：佛教文明經典》（新北：立緒文化，2017年）。
蔡耀明，《佛教視角的生命哲學與世界觀》（台北：文津出版社，2012年）。
textbook.en:
Yao-ming Tsai (ed.), Readings in World Civilizations V: Classics of Buddhist Civilizations, New Taipei: New Century Publishing, 2017.
Yao-ming Tsai, Philosophy of Life and Worldview from the Perspective of Buddhist Teachings, Taipei: Wen Chin Publishing, 2012.

gradMethod.ch:
(1) 出席與積極參與課程活動 (30％)
(2) 課程資料研讀心得與報告 (第三週開始). (30％)
(3) 期中報告 (10％)
(4) 期末報告 (30％)
gradMethod.en:
(1) Class attendance and active participation in class discussions. (30％)
(2) Class presentations on the required readings (beginning on week 3). (30％)
(3) A rough draft of a research paper and midterm presentation. (10％)
(4) The research paper will count for 30％ of your grade for the course.
